message.content:
Bell pepper, also known as sweet pepper or capsicum, is a cultivar group of the species Capsicum annuum.
It is a large, fleshy vegetable with a bell-like shape, ranging in color from green, red, yellow, orange, and even purple.
The smooth surface of the pepper has a slight shine to it and is characteristic of the cultivar.
The flesh of the bell pepper is crunchy and juicy, with a mild, sweet flavor.
It is a popular ingredient in many culinary dishes, particularly in Mediterranean and Latin American cuisine.
Bell peppers are commonly used fresh in salads, roasted, grilled, stuffed, or sautéed in various recipes.
They can be found in the produce section of grocery stores or farmers markets year-round.
